articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian and Ukrainian negotiators will meet in Istanbul for their first peace talks in more than three years as both sides come under pressure from U.S. President Donald Trump to end Europe's deadliest conflict since World War Two.
articles.title: Russia and Ukraine to hold first direct peace talks in over three years

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli strikes on Gaza have killed more than 250 people since Thursday morning, local health authorities said, one of the deadliest phases of bombardment since a truce collapsed in March and with a new ground offensive expected soon.
articles.title: Deadly Israeli strikes pound Gaza as Trump says 'people are starving'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The man who stabbed and partially blinded novelist Salman Rushdie onstage at a Western New York arts institute in 2022 was sentenced to 25 years in prison on Friday for an attack that also wounded a second man, the district attorney said.
articles.title: Assailant who stabbed author Salman Rushdie sentenced to 25 years

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday the United Arab Emirates and the United States have agreed to create a path for the Gulf country to buy some of the most advanced artificial intelligence semiconductors from U.S. companies.
articles.title: UAE and US agree on path for Abu Dhabi to buy most advanced AI chips, Trump says

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Andrew Osborn
articles.description: This would be the largest prisoner exchange since 2022.
articles.title: Russia says Ukraine talks yielded a prisoner swap deal and an agreement to keep talking

articles.author: Isabel Teles, Ana Mano
articles.description: Brazil, the world's largest poultry exporter, confirmed its first outbreak of avian influenza on a commercial farm in a statement from the Agriculture Ministry on Friday, raising the prospect of restrictions from trade partners.
articles.title: Brazil confirms first outbreak of avian influenza on commercial farm

articles.author: Jessica Donati, Emma Farge, Ammu Kannampilly, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: The food stocks have been stuck inside four U.S. government warehouses since the Trump administration's decision in January to cut global aid programs.
articles.title: Exclusive: US aid cuts leave food for millions mouldering in storage

articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg, Anthony Deutsch
articles.description: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, Karim Khan, has stepped down temporarily as an investigation by the United Nations into alleged sexual misconduct by him nears its end, his office said on Friday.
articles.title: ICC prosecutor Khan on leave amid sexual misconduct probe

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: Escorts of camels and Arabian horses. A luxury plane offered as a gift. Hundreds of men dancing with drums and scimitars before marble palaces.
articles.title: Gulf states use opulence and flattery to win Trump's heart

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Swedish journalist Joakim Medin, who was jailed in March in Turkey on terrorism and insult charges, is on his way home, Sweden's Prime Minister said on Friday.
articles.title: Swedish PM says jailed reporter on his way home from Turkey
